Topic.Title: Android fatal security flaws....

Message.Msg: Another lying slander. Quoting from the researchers' paper: "Polymorphic attacks have long been a plague for traditional desktop and server systems. While there exist earlier studies on the effectiveness of anti-malware tools on PCs [4], our domain of study is different in that we exclusively focus on mobile devices like smartphones that require different ways for anti-malware design." In other words, everything they say about Android is equally true of Windows. The only difference is that for this study, they chose to concentrate on a mobile system, precisely because it has become so commercially important recently.

Topic.Title: Android fatal security flaws....

Message.Msg: I think if they looked deeper into Trend Micro and ex engineers they would have some leads. I also think that stories like the one that 36 entire countries were subjected to fake Mozilla Firefox software that was spyware according to Mozilla shows the problem. I heard about this because Mozilla sued to the company. What about reporting it to law enforcement? What about helping the people who's systems were compromised? It appears that the majority of the problems are swept under the rug because it is easier and cheaper than dealing with the FBI etc. If the real amount of problems were know it would be scary. Android devices were approved to be allowed into DOD bld. like the Pentagon this week. They have to have Knox on them. It is hard to get a clear answer from Google on if these devices, which devices and when they will all be safe for DOD blds. Google last said there will be a delay. It looks really bad., DOD It staff has the authority to enter those device remotely at any time. I wonder what this is going to do bringing the malware problem out in the open of Android devices. If Google cannot stop it or security software cannot the OS should be scrapped. It is a cluster F with Android and no one knows which are infected with malware. They just know that a lot are like 65% of all Android. Is Windows Phone Safe, so far yes. When Microsoft finally releases it's own phone it will be much safer and clearer. I was using a Surface last night and was noticing how much smoother, faster and better everything worked compared to an Acer etc. You could feel it even in the fliks of the screen. The display looked deeper and clearer also. There are just little problems say with a touch pad on the devices that were not made by Microsoft that make all the difference. I for one cannot wait until Microsoft becomes a pure hardware play and makes their own phone, tablets and PC's.

Topic.Title: XBOX 720 to have $15.00 a month subscription fee....

Message.Msg: Just to add that during the third quarter 2013 earnings, MSFT reported that Xbox Live subscriptions have increased 18% over the prior year's same period. The total number of subscribers is now over 46 million worldwide. Additionally, the entertainment and devices division posted revenue of $2.53 billion, which is up "56%" over last year. SO the $15.00 subscription for XBOX 720 will further balloon our earnings and if we decide to compete with Netflix, you can do the math.... IT is also worth noting that Electronic Arts will be producing the next few games (such as Respawn) as XBOX "exclusive" and that would be the real driving force for increasing our subscription base. Cheers Osso

Message.Title: T-Mobile announces "budget-friendly" Nokia Lumia 521, available in May....
Message.Msg: T-Mobile on Tuesday announced the upcoming availability of the budget-friendly Nokia (NOK) Lumia 521 smartphone. The budget-friendly device is equipped with a 4-inch 800 x 480-pixel display, a dual-core 1GHz processor and a 5-megapixel rear camera. The handset also includes 512MB of RAM, 8GB of internal storage, a microSD slot, HSPA+ 21Mbps connectivity and the Windows Phone 8 operating system. The Lumia 521 is scheduled to be released in May and will be available in Walmart (WMT), T-Mobile and Microsoft (MSFT) retail stores

Message.Title: Twitter sets a May 7th kill date for TweetDeck Android, iPhone, AIR and Facebook integration....
Message.Msg: Back in March, Twitter announced that TweetDeck AIR, TweetDeck for Android and TweetDeck for iPhone would be killed off. At the time they gave a general ‘early May’ estimate, but today they’ve nailed down the date that they’ll actually go dark: May 7th. At that time, an update to the TweetDeck blog states, the apps will be removed from their respective app stores and cease to function. At that point, the Facebook integration to all TweetDeck products will also get shut off.

Message.Title: Microsoft promotes Surface Pro with personal stories from owners: 'I no longer need my iPad'....
Message.Msg: Microsoft has begun a new monthly series on its Surface Blog, highlighting a user's experience with the software giant's Surface Pro tablet device. In the first installment, Microsoft introduces us to Philip De Rop, a Quality Assurance Manager at a supply chain software company. In the blog post, De Rop talks about his travels with his Apple iPad and how it gets in the way almost all the time. However, with Microsoft's Surface Pro, De Rop no longer needs his iPad and considers the Surface Pro a replacement to his laptop. "I no longer need my iPad, which saves up a tray at the customs at airports. My laptop bag became a lot lighter. Now people stare at me when I unpack the Surface. I see them think, how can he work using only that small tablet?" De Rop states. He emphasizes how the Surface Pro takes up little space, compared to the iPad which took up a lot of space, especially when traveling. De Rop also mentions how he can plug his Windows Phone into his Surface Pro charger, and charge both his smartphone and the device at the same time. Again, taking up little space. "I have hooked up two 24 inch screens through a Targus USB 3.0 Dual Video Docking Station. With my laptop, I had to close my lid and could not use the laptop screen. Now I even have access to the Surface Touch screen. A full size keyboard and mouse are linked to the docking station. Why would I ever need an iPad again?" De Rop adds.

Message.Title: BitNami Brings Open Source Apps to Windows Azure Infrastructure Services....
Message.Msg: SOON most Open Source Developers will realize that game is over for Android et al.... "In connection with the General Availability release of Windows Azure Infrastructure Services, BitNami announces that it has collaborated with Microsoft to bring its library of popular open source web applications and development frameworks to Windows Azure". The BitNami applications are available free of charge and can be deployed to Windows Azure in one click. The BitNami app store includes a wide range of best-of-breed applications for customer relationship management (CRM), wikis, project management, portal and website development, blogging and much more. Over 60 applications and development environments are currently available for Windows Azure, including: SugarCRM, Alfresco, WordPress, Drupal, Liferay, Redmine, Joomla!, Ruby on Rails and LAMP. "We are excited about the announcement of GA for the Windows Azure Infrastructure Services offering. We have seen first hand its rapid evolution into a world-class, cost-effective infrastructure platform that every business should consider when pondering a move to the cloud," said Daniel Lopez, CEO of BitNami. "With Windows Azure Infrastructure Services, Microsoft has unmatched flexibility that lets customers choose to deploy infrastructure in the public cloud, on premises, or as a hybrid implementation,” said David Aiken, group product marketing manager, Server and Tools Marketing, Microsoft. “As an important part of our cloud ecosystem, we are happy to see BitNami’s continued support for Windows Azure. Their one-click app packages enable our customers to deploy a wide variety of applications to the cloud in minutes."

Message.Title: Walmart Will Start Selling Nokia's Dirt-Cheap Windows Phone Next Week (Source Business Insider)....
Message.Msg: Microsoft may have found a sweet spot with its Nokia Lumia 521, the less-than-$150 Windows smartphone for T-Mobile. Walmart will start carrying the phone next week, reports Reuters Bill Rigby. The 521 sold out in four days at the first retailer to carry it, the Home Shopping Network. The 521 is a T-Mobile-specific variant of the Lumia 520 that debuted at Mobile World Congress in February. It offers good-but-average hardware for the price (1 GHz dual-core processor, 4-inch touch screen, a 5-megapixel camera, 8G storage expandable to 64G). However, the phone doesn't require a long-term contract. Walmart will sell it with T-Mobile's $30/month unlimited data and text plan. The more users WP-8 has, the more app developers it will attract. More apps will bring in more users.

Also a family of five can own 5 Lumia 521 handsets for the price of one iPhone and above all with an affordable unlimited plan for $1 per day.... AND that is a good thing. Topic.Title: BitNami Brings Open Source Apps to Windows Azure Infrastructure Services....

Message.Msg: YOU see as long as the Developers respect the rules of the game and develop Apps on top of the Windows Platform, all would be fine.... SO if they by-pass our Patents/Intellectual Property and write code by claiming "Open Source" privileges, they will be facing a harsh reaction from MSFT.... AND that is why we signed up 10,000 new customers last months alone as the customers realize that MSFT offers the best value for the money without any short-cuts and back-door gymnastics.... AND I expect this trend to continue and more Apps Developers come and knock on our door as paying royalties to MSFT will kill the Linux/Android based practices and their business model(s). Cheers Osso
